Interface MediaRssItemData

All Known Subinterfaces:
FeedItem, MediaRssItem, SpotifyItem, YoutubeItem
All Known Implementing Classes:
FeedItemImpl, MediaRssItemDataImpl, MediaRssItemImpl, SpotifyItemImpl, YoutubeItemImpl
public interface MediaRssItemData

  • Method Details

    • getMediaRssItemData

      MediaRssItemData getMediaRssItemData()

    • getMediaContents

      default List<MediaContent> getMediaContents()
      Returns the list of media content elements associated with this item. Each item represents a media object, such as video, audio, or image, and may include attributes like URL, type, medium, duration, and more, as defined by the Media RSS specification.
      Returns:
      list of media content elements

    • addMediaContents

      default void addMediaContents(MediaContent mediaContent)
      Adds a media content element to this item. Use this to associate a new media object with the item.
      Parameters:
      mediaContent - the media content element to add

    • getMediaGroup

      default Optional<MediaGroup> getMediaGroup()
      Returns the media group associated with this item, if present. A group allows grouping of media objects that are different representations of the same content.
      Returns:
      optional media group

    • setMediaGroup

      default void setMediaGroup(MediaGroup mediaGroup)
      Sets the media group for this item. Use this to group multiple media objects representing the same content in different formats.
      Parameters:
      mediaGroup - the media group to set

    • getMediaLocations

      default List<MediaLocation> getMediaLocations()
      Returns the list of media location elements for this item. Each location specifies geographical information about places captured in the media content.
      Returns:
      list of media locations

    • addMediaLocation

      default void addMediaLocation(MediaLocation mediaLocation)
      Adds a media location element to this item. Use this to specify a location referenced in the media object, including description and time offsets.
      Parameters:
      mediaLocation - the media location to add

    • getMediaRatings

      default List<MediaRating> getMediaRatings()
      Gets a list of media rating that declares the permissible audience. If this element is not included, it assumes that no restrictions are necessary. The rating can use different schemes like urn:simple (adult | nonadult), urn:mpaa (g | pg | pg-13 | r | nc-17), urn:v-chip, or urn:icra.
      Returns:
      media rating or empty if not set

    • addMediaRating

      default void addMediaRating(MediaRating mediaRating)
      Sets the media rating that declares the permissible audience. If this element is not included, it assumes that no restrictions are necessary. The rating can use different schemes like urn:simple (adult | nonadult), urn:mpaa (g | pg | pg-13 | r | nc-17), urn:v-chip, or urn:icra.
      Parameters:
      mediaRating - media rating

    • getMediaTitle

      default Optional<MediaTitle> getMediaTitle()
      Returns the title for this item, if present. The title provides a human-readable name for the media object, with optional plain or HTML text formatting.
      Returns:
      optional title

    • setMediaTitle

      default void setMediaTitle(MediaTitle mediaTitle)
      Sets the title for this item. Use this to specify the name of the media object, supporting plain or HTML text.
      Parameters:
      mediaTitle - the title to set

    • getMediaDescription

      default Optional<MediaDescription> getMediaDescription()
      Returns the description for this item, if present. The description provides a short summary of the media object, with optional plain or HTML text formatting.
      Returns:
      optional description

    • setMediaDescription

      default void setMediaDescription(MediaDescription mediaDescription)
      Sets the description for this item. Use this to specify a short summary of the media object, supporting plain or HTML text.
      Parameters:
      mediaDescription - the description to set

    • getMediaKeywords

      default List<String> getMediaKeywords()
      Returns the list of keywords describing the media object. Keywords are comma-delimited and relevant to the media object, typically up to 10 words.
      Returns:
      list of keywords

    • addMediaKeyword

      default void addMediaKeyword(String mediaKeyword)
      Adds a keyword describing the media object. Use this to provide relevant keywords for indexing and discovery.
      Parameters:
      mediaKeyword - the keyword to add

    • getMediaThumbnails

      default List<MediaThumbnail> getMediaThumbnails()
      Returns the list of thumbnails for this item. Thumbnails are representative images for the media object, with attributes for URL, width, height, and time offset.
      Returns:
      list of thumbnails

    • addMediaThumbnail

      default void addMediaThumbnail(MediaThumbnail mediaThumbnail)
      Adds a thumbnail to this item. Use this to associate a representative image with the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaThumbnail - the thumbnail to add

    • getMediaCategories

      default List<MediaCategory> getMediaCategories()
      Returns the list of categories for this item. Categories allow taxonomy assignment to indicate the type and contents of the media object, with optional scheme and label attributes.
      Returns:
      list of categories

    • addMediaCategory

      default void addMediaCategory(MediaCategory mediaCategory)
      Adds a category to this item. Use this to specify taxonomy or categorization for the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaCategory - the category to add

    • getMediaHashes

      default List<MediaHash> getMediaHashes()
      Returns the list of hashes for this item. Hashes provide a value for the media object, useful for duplicate detection and caching, with optional algorithm attribute.
      Returns:
      list of hashes

    • addMediaHash

      default void addMediaHash(MediaHash mediaHash)
      Adds a hash to this item. Use this to associate a hash value with the media object for identification purposes.
      Parameters:
      mediaHash - the hash to add

    • getMediaPlayer

      default Optional<MediaPlayer> getMediaPlayer()
      Returns the media player information for this item, if present. The media player provides a URL to a web-based media player for the media object, with optional width and height attributes.
      Returns:
      optional media player information

    • setMediaPlayer

      default void setMediaPlayer(MediaPlayer mediaPlayer)
      Sets the media player information for this item. Use this to specify a web-based player URL for the media object, with optional dimensions.
      Parameters:
      mediaPlayer - the media player information to set

    • getMediaCredits

      default List<MediaCredit> getMediaCredits()
      Returns the list of credits for this item. Credits identify notable entities and their contributions to the creation of the media object, with optional role and scheme attributes.
      Returns:
      list of credits

    • addMediaCredit

      default void addMediaCredit(MediaCredit mediaCredit)
      Adds a credit to this item. Use this to specify contributors, such as people or companies, and their roles in the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaCredit - the credit to add

    • getMediaCopyright

      default Optional<MediaCopyright> getMediaCopyright()
      Returns the copyright information for this item, if present. Copyright information may include a URL for terms of use or additional details.
      Returns:
      optional copyright information

    • setMediaCopyright

      default void setMediaCopyright(MediaCopyright mediaCopyright)
      Sets the copyright information for this item. Use this to specify copyright details for the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaCopyright - the copyright information to set

    • getMediaTexts

      default List<MediaText> getMediaTexts()
      Returns the list of text elements for this item. Text elements allow inclusion of transcripts, closed captioning, or lyrics, with support for time offsets and language.
      Returns:
      list of text elements

    • addMediaText

      default void addMediaText(MediaText mediaText)
      Adds a text element to this item. Use this to provide transcripts, captions, or lyrics for the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaText - the text element to add

    • getMediaRestrictions

      default List<MediaRestriction> getMediaRestrictions()
      Returns the list of restrictions for this item. Restrictions allow specification of limitations on the media object, such as geographic, URI, or sharing restrictions.
      Returns:
      list of restrictions

    • addMediaRestriction

      default void addMediaRestriction(MediaRestriction mediaRestriction)
      Adds a restriction to this item. Use this to specify syndication or sharing restrictions for the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaRestriction - the restriction to add

    • getMediaCommunity

      default Optional<MediaCommunity> getMediaCommunity()
      Returns the community information for this item, if present. Community information includes feedback, ratings, statistics, and tags for the media object.
      Returns:
      optional community information

    • setMediaCommunity

      default void setMediaCommunity(MediaCommunity mediaCommunity)
      Sets the community information for this item. Use this to include community feedback, ratings, statistics, and tags for the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaCommunity - the community information to set

    • getMediaComments

      default List<String> getMediaComments()
      Returns the list of comments for this item. Comments allow inclusion of user feedback associated with the media object.
      Returns:
      list of comments

    • addMediaComment

      default void addMediaComment(String mediaComment)
      Adds a comment to this item. Use this to associate user feedback with the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaComment - the comment to add

    • getMediaEmbed

      default Optional<MediaEmbed> getMediaEmbed()
      Returns the embed information for this item, if present. Embed information allows inclusion of player-specific embed code for the media object, with support for key-value parameters.
      Returns:
      optional embed information

    • setMediaEmbed

      default void setMediaEmbed(MediaEmbed mediaEmbed)
      Sets the embed information for this item. Use this to provide embeddable player code for the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaEmbed - the embed information to set

    • getMediaResponses

      default List<String> getMediaResponses()
      Returns the list of responses for this item. Responses allow inclusion of feedback or reactions received by the media object.
      Returns:
      list of responses

    • addMediaResponse

      default void addMediaResponse(String mediaResponse)
      Adds a response to this item. Use this to associate feedback or reactions with the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaResponse - the response to add

    • getMediaBackLinks

      default List<String> getMediaBackLinks()
      Returns the list of back links for this item. Back links allow inclusion of URLs referencing the media object.
      Returns:
      list of back links

    • addMediaBackLink

      default void addMediaBackLink(String mediaBackLink)
      Adds a back link to this item. Use this to associate URLs that reference the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaBackLink - the back link to add

    • getMediaStatus

      default Optional<MediaStatus> getMediaStatus()
      Returns the status information for this item, if present. Status information specifies the current state of the media object, such as active, blocked, or deleted, and may include a reason.
      Returns:
      optional status information

    • setMediaStatus

      default void setMediaStatus(MediaStatus mediaStatus)
      Sets the status information for this item. Use this to specify the current state of the media object, including reason for blocking or deletion.
      Parameters:
      mediaStatus - the status information to set

    • getMediaPrices

      default List<MediaPrice> getMediaPrices()
      Returns the list of prices for this item. Price information includes pricing details for the media object, supporting multiple pricing structures and currencies.
      Returns:
      list of prices

    • addMediaPrice

      default void addMediaPrice(MediaPrice mediaPrice)
      Adds a price to this item. Use this to specify pricing details for the media object, including type, price, currency, and info URL.
      Parameters:
      mediaPrice - the price to add

    • getMediaLicenses

      default List<MediaLicense> getMediaLicenses()
      Returns the license information for this item, if present. License information provides machine-readable details about the rights associated with the media object.
      Returns:
      optional license information

    • addMediaLicense

      default void addMediaLicense(MediaLicense mediaLicense)
      Sets the license information for this item. Use this to specify license details for the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaLicense - the license information to set

    • getMediaSubTitles

      default List<MediaSubTitle> getMediaSubTitles()
      Returns the list of subtitles for this item. Subtitles provide links for subtitle or closed captioning, supporting multiple languages and types.
      Returns:
      list of subtitles

    • addMediaSubTitle

      default void addMediaSubTitle(MediaSubTitle mediaSubTitle)
      Adds a subtitle to this item. Use this to associate subtitle or closed captioning links with the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaSubTitle - the subtitle to add

    • getMediaPeerLinks

      default List<MediaPeerLink> getMediaPeerLinks()
      Returns the list of peer links for this item. Peer links provide P2P links for the media object, such as BitTorrent files.
      Returns:
      list of peer links

    • addMediaPeerLink

      default void addMediaPeerLink(MediaPeerLink mediaPeerLink)
      Adds a peer link to this item. Use this to associate P2P links with the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaPeerLink - the peer link to add

    • getMediaRights

      default Optional<MediaRights> getMediaRights()
      Returns the rights information of a media object, if present. Rights information specifies the rights status of the media object, such as user-created or official.
      Returns:
      optional rights information

    • setMediaRights

      default void setMediaRights(MediaRights mediaRights)
      Sets the rights information of a media object. Use this to specify the rights status of the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaRights - the rights information to set

    • getMediaScenes

      default List<MediaScene> getMediaScenes()
      Returns the list of scenes for this item. Scene information specifies details about specific segments within the media object, such as title, description, and time offsets.
      Returns:
      list of scenes

    • addMediaScene

      default void addMediaScene(MediaScene mediaScenes)
      Adds a scene to this item. Use this to associate scene-specific information, such as title, description, and time offsets, with the media object.
      Parameters:
      mediaScenes - the scene to add
